title.narrative: Spice Up the Deal Phase Two (SUD II)

description.narrative:
1. 15,000 farmers have increased yield and improved quality of spices produced, and are able to deliver their produce sorted by quality grade in order to benefit from price differentiation,through the adoption of improved growing, harvesting and post-harvest practices.
2. 15 farmer business groups are formed and operating in 15 communities,allowing farmers to join forces, strengthen their marketing and negotiation position, and play an effective role as actors in the spice value chain.
3. The Maluku Spice Council is strengthened and fulfills its role as an effective business hub connecting buyers/exporters and spice farmers throughout Maluku.

Mercy Corps developed the Spice Up the Deal program to address the spice sector constraints described above through a holistic approach, acknowledging that only systemic changes will sustainably improve the socioeconomic conditions for poor spice-producing communities in Ambon and Seram.
Through market development interventions at different levels of the spice value chain, the program seeks to improve the ability of this value chain to better support Maluku’s spice sector and improve socioeconomic conditions of spice farmers in the region.
The program aims to increase economic opportunities for spice farmers and increase their income through improving production processes, strengthening farmer business/collection groups, and fostering ‘win-win’ business relationships between farmer groups and buyers. To this end, SUD fosters effective cooperation between stakeholders, cultivates government awareness and support to benefit Maluku’s spice sector, and strategically facilitates inputs and services markets.
